page.title: 05EDUCATION
page.content: The grid contains a village Primary School at Rhewl.This was established in 1918 under Denbighshire C.C. On roll upon opening were 19 pupils. Upon the building of the Council Estates at Rhewl & Llanynys in the 1950's the school population grew to an all-time high of 93 in 1973 but has steadily shrunk tothe 43 of today. Following the 1870 Education Act the Church originally provided elementary education in a building adjacent to the present school,now a private house. The school is essentially bilingual with a teaching staff of 2,one being the Head. A Residential School for problematical children from Merseyside also lies within the grid.Sunday School, once flourishing, is weakly attended today.
